Reviews.Title: “No frills, but very convenient”
Reviews.Author: 121star
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was having a special rate (stay 2 nights, get the 3rd night free). It was about one of five different hotels in the immediate area, so I wasn't expecting anything fancy. It was close to the 10 freeway, which was incredibly convenient when navigating to all the different ballparks in Phoenix and Glendale. The fitness center was bare bones (1 treadmills, 1 elliptical, and 1 bike) and the pool was very small. The continental breakfast was a definite plus, and all the employees I interacted with were very nice and helpful. The room was clean and met our needs. I would definitely stay here again for my next spring training trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: stsimmer
Reviews.Content: Very average price at a chain that is not known as top of the line - yet we found the room to be very nicely outfitted. Comfortable beds, premium quality sheets, microwave, fridge and flat-screen TV. And clean! Front desk was very friendly. Clientele were mostly sports fans (baseball spring training) and I dislike that so many people come down to the breakfast bar in their pajamas. (Can't you at least pull on a pair of jeans?) Anyway, we had a good night's sleep and enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Probably a fine place but my stay had it's share of problems”
Reviews.Author: Pickyonejustme
Reviews.Content: I really want to rate this hotel well as I think it has potential of being above average, however I am being generous at rating it average solely based on the experiences I had during my stay. After a long day getting there, I arrived late in the evening only to be told there was not a room available for me. The lady behind the counter was very apologetic (which I appreciated) and stated a large group of people had not checked out that day as scheduled and consequently they did not have a room available for me. She noted that I was a Choice Priviledge member and said they made arrangements to put me up next door for the night. She said they would comp my room for that night and that the rest of my 6 night stay would indeed be back here where I originally booked. I was exhausted and not knowing the condition of the establishment next door, I agreed. Without writing more of a novel than I already am, let me just say the place next door was unacceptable. It was a complete dump, filthy and disgusting. I was NOT happy. If I had wanted to stay in a dump, I would have booked a room there. They could have at least put me in a comparable quality establishment, of which there were several in the area. The next day I was indeed given a room here for the remainder of my stay. Upon entering my assigned room, it initially appeared fine and of the quality I had expected. However after setting my laptop up on the desk and was preparing to sit down and do some work, I discovered there was no desk chair. I called down to inquire and was tld someone would bring me a chair. A short time later, a young man did indeed show up with a brand new chair he stated he just assembled for me. Ok, that was impressive. Problem solved. The next morning, when I opened the closet to get the iron, I discovered the ironing board was missing. Once again, I called down and was promptly delivered an ironing board. Ok so kudos for problem solving. I also discovered there were no hand towels or wash cloths in the bathroom. Ok so now I'm wondering if this had been a room they were just using to rob Peter to pay Paul with items they needed for other guests. I might also just mention, in case they are reading this review, please invest the additional $0.15 a roll for something other than bargain brand toilet paper. The shower pressure was anemic and the temperature was very hard to control. Other than these complaints, the room was fine, very clean and the beds were moderately comfortable. Oh speaking of clean, upon arrival back to my room on the second night at 5:15pm, I discovered my room had not been cleaned yet. "Really"? After calling housekeeping, I was advised the cleaning staff was still working on my floor and would be there momentarily. Apparantly not an expeditious crew. Fortunately, I was leaving again to go out for dinner, so it worked out. This happenned once again on the last night of my stay and finally at 5pm I stepped out into the hallway and advised the cleaning staff (who coincidentally was just standing in the hallway chatting) that I would not need my room cleaned tonight at this late in the day as I was not going to leave while they did their work. The breakfast selections were plentiful however the eggs were unedible, rubbery and with a slight chemical taste. The ice machines on 2 of the 3 floors were out of order. One vending machine ate my money. The cigarette receptacles outside had not been emptied during my entire stay and wer overflowing. The coffee pot in my room was not used for two of the days during my stay as no cream/sugar packets had been left during the cleaning process. I could easily rate this hotel much lower based on my experiences during my stay, however my gut tells me there is potential here for an above average establishment. The staff was always very friendly and most of my problems were dealt with swiftly. I will chalk off my issues to the exception and hopefully not the rule with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Service needs A LOT of work!!”
Reviews.Author: Chee26
Reviews.Content: Me and my family recently stayed at this hotel for about 3-4 days. Not the best of stays. Maybe it was due to the fact that the entire place was full during our entire stay. After the first night, our room keys had been deactivated because the front desk had us down for one night, although our reservation (which was made months in advance) clearly said 5 nights. This was corrected quickly. However, my room was never cleaned other than towels being changed out. The one time the room was "cleaned", housekeeping only made up one bed in our two queen bedroom. The trash was never emptied, and the tables/desk stayed dirty with empty water bottles and napkins because the trash cans were overflowing. They do have free breakfast in the morning. This stayed busy from the time it opened until after it was closed. This wouldn't have been so bad unless you were lucky enough to be stuck in a line of people trying to check-out, check-in, or complain about THEIR rooms not being cleaned to the ONE person at the front desk who had to handle all of this on top of answering phones. My dad was basically accused of lying about staying in a room that he had been in for two days when his room key did not work for the SECOND time during his stay. The front desk clerk actually told my dad he wasn't in that room, and that it was "Mr. Johnson's" room. The clerk then proceeded to walk my dad to his room to prove him wrong. After knocking on my parents door while my parents stood in the hall and watched, he quickly saw that he was wrong and well... how would YOU feel in that situation. Long story short, maybe we came on a busy week, but that doesn't mean a business should cut corners on service. If anything they should be stepping it up or letting their guests know whats going on so that we're not wondering why such a nice place is handing out crappy service. Decent rates, but get it together at the front desk and train your housekeeping staff to actually clean the rooms. Never stayed at a hotel where I had to request someone to clean my room every day I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, close to where the Brew Crew play”
Reviews.Author: erin h
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Hotel seems new. The staff at the front desk is very, very friendly. The room was clean and the king bed was sooooo comfortable. It's close to where the Brewers play, so that is a plus. I loved that the maids weren't banging down our door at 8 a.m to clean the room. The breakfast was also great. It's located right off of I17 and I10. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: CloudPurpose
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice and comfortable. Breakfast was good, they were a little slow replenishiing the food, but there was a nice selection and all was fresh!

Reviews.Title: “Secret is out of the bag!”
Reviews.Author: Gerald D
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Phoenix quite a bit due to having property there. I have been searching for a hotel that would not cost more than 100 bucks and be clean and in overall good condition. Folks, I paid 55 bucks and it is the best deal I could ever get! I have been to other places and have paid more and got the same results. Very comfortable beds, flat screen t.v. clean bathroom. Heck, even went into the Jacuzzi (which I never do) and that was fine. I did not eat the breakfast, so no clue about that. This will be the place I now stay.

Reviews.Title: “No towels, no coffee for pot, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: andrewseliz
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, the front desk person just handed me the room key and said your room is 204. Have a nice night. No directions on where to park, where to walk in, where to find the elevators, any info about breakfast. Not that I really care, but he just had absolutely nothing to say to me except for my room number( and one room key for three people). There were three of us in the room, and we had ONE washcloth (which was found in the floor of the bathtub) and two towels. That's it. No hand towels or anything. My mom took a shower before bed and used the one washcloth so I had to use a corner of a towel to wash my face and then use the same towel for my shower in the morning. I had no washcloths to use for my toddler. Also, there was a coffee pot and lots of little sugar/cream packets, but no coffee in the room anywhere. No pods, packs. Nothing. Seemss like they need a little bit better management. Also, the lid to the toilet tank was cracked completely into two pieces.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jeff G
Reviews.Content: This was a quick getaway from the midwest cold. The hotel was located off the interstate yet quiet. The staff was attentive to our needs, The rooms are spacious not a suite but not clausetrophobic either. Just perfect to return to after a day of fun in the sun taking on the many activities. The price was a great value even before the ammenities were added in such as the complementary full breakfast, and a heated outdoor pool and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Denise S
Reviews.Content: Front Office Staff were very professional, accomodating, friendly & knowledgable of local amenities. Room was clean; nice room for great rate. Would stay again as all staff I encountered were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl1977
Reviews.Content: I was passing through Phoenix and needed something that was convenient to the freeway. This place was clean, comfortable and the people were very nice! I'd stay here again next time I need to drive through AZ.

Reviews.Title: “Maintainance is awful!”
Reviews.Author: SoftballBart
Reviews.Content: The rooms are comfortable, but so many things don't work or aren't right! One of three ice machines operates, the jets in the hot tub are clogged, the back security door is unlocked, even the main light switch in the rooms turn off the bedside lights as well as the entrance light. One room "dresser" is only for decoration (the drawers are false). The business center computer lacks a printer. Breakfast isn't too bad, but the eggs are obviously powdered. Housekeeping missed making up our room one day.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyColonel
Reviews.Content: This property was a Hampton Inn previously. I stayed here for 1 night and found it to be clean and quiet. There are flat screen TV`s in the rooms with a good channel selection. The night I stayed there, there were VERY few cars in the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kpondrias
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and perfect! Breakfast was yummy and the staff was extremely friendly. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdsnowbunny
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service, wonderful atmosphere and very pleasant. Problem w/ next door neighbors and front desk took care of it instantly! Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - with many amenities that most other hotels nickel & dime you for.”
Reviews.Author: ajmitchell
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at hotels with more stars behind their name but on this trip, I needed to be close to some meetings and there were not many options. This hotel completely exceeded my expectations. Starting with the lobby, the staff was extremely gracious, there was fresh brewed coffee all day long, and the complimentary continental breakfast provided each morning had a very nice variety of options. The King room had a comfortable bed with great pillows, removable/washable duvet, nice seating area and was very spacious. The internet was working great and was also provided at no charge. A small coffee machine, microwave and fridge were also included - this was great because I could shop for misc. items and keep them in the fridge or heat them up later. Although the facility is not new, it's been well looked after, fresh paint and a housekeeping staff that does a fantastic job. These days the most expensive hotels charge individually for everything you can possibly imagine - it's ridiculous. At I-10 West Hotel I paid less than $100 per night and got more for my money than I ever have before!

Reviews.Title: “The best location, very clean and well presented, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rose_AnnYuma_Az
Reviews.Content: We spent the night in your hotel Fri. Jan 28/11 and found it to be so great. The rooms were attractive when we entered them. The beds had throw pillows with color on the white bedding. Glad to see how white everything was. I would give you 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: arnold_hall
Reviews.Content: The beds are very comfortable! Everything from the lobby to the room was clean and inviting. The rate was very reasonable! The service was great. Jazzlan, who was the young lady at the front desk was very helpful. She gave us great recommendations and directions. I would say this is the best hotel in the west of phoenix. The surrounding hotels don't match up to the quality of this hotel, which was formerly a Hampton. Jazzlan said they are undergoing a franchise change so that's why the name of the hotel isn't familiar.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff - excellent value - wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: marskyvalley
Reviews.Content: Braison at front desk and CeCe in breakfast room were very helpful and friendly. Room was clean and location was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “This IS NOT a Hampton Inn ANYMORE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: waasseattle8803
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the same and neither is the area. BEWARE!! We have stayed in this Hampton Inn many times before and it was just fine. Not it's called

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: NorthernAzDrewD
Reviews.Content: Great Stay and would stay again next time in town. Staff was very nice and felt safe in the Hotel. Breakfast Bar was excellent and food was fresh and always refilled if needed, General Manager was always available when needed and showed interest in the guest as well as the Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hampton Inn but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: HOaKIE
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on a business trip. The hotel is not a new Hampton Inn. Seems to have been around awhile. The area is not great. The hotel next door caters to trucks & RVs so do not get a room on that side of the hotel (noisy). The rooms are typical Hampton Inn. The breakfast was decent and the front desk staff was helpful. I paid $139/night which is too much for the quality of this hotel. I tried to find a Courtyard or other similar hotel in the area but could not find anything I liked under $150/night. So the Hampton fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Area's gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: theej
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this hotel over a period of several years. Although the hotel itself is still above average, I was extremely surprised to see that the area around the hotel has diminished in character - not to be too blunt, I would not consider walking out of the hotel after dark. It is unfortunate that this has happened, but even though the hotel is very comfortable, I don't think I would stay there again because of the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, felt safe”
Reviews.Author: Charlesgate
Reviews.Content: We found the positive comments about this hotel spot on. The hotel is located halfway between the downtown/airport and U. Phoenix stadium. 11 miles to everything - no trouble getting a cab. Even though the hotel was full and very busy, staff was extremely helpful, rooms and breakfast were at highest level for a Hampton Inn. We were able to check in at 10am with no questions asked. The location is right off the highway, with several other similar chain hotels nearby. Although there is nothing charming to recommend the area, we walked around a little and didn't see anything to suggest that it would be unsafe. Our view is not typical, though, because we were there for the Super Bowl and the adjacent hotel was HQ for the auxiliary state troopers brought in for the event.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bseashore
Reviews.Content: June 2007 found us staying at this Hampton Inn in Phoenix on Latham. We were attending a conference and read the reviews on-line about this property. It was a perfect location for us. The property grounds are beautifully maintained. The front desk staff professional and friendly. The rooms are typical of a Hampton Inn - maybe a wee bit nicer. They were clean, new linens, quiet (even close to the freeway), friendly housekeeping staff too. The area is not the reason we stayed but the convenience to I-10. I saw the negative comments about the location but they were not a factor in our decision to chose this location. Also, there are multiple places to dine fairly close and that also was not a problem. I would recommend this location and stay here again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Hotel - Highly Recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: heartfelt57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just cspent a great vacation in Sedona Arizona and are headed back to Los Angeles. We wanted to take our time driving back and spend a night in Phoenix with easy access to the I-10. I am thrilled that we decided to stay at the Hampton Inn. I really expected to be disappointed after our stay at a Sedona Resort but this place is lovely. The room with 2 queen beds is very large, the beds are extremely comfortable, the internet access is perfect, the bathroom and room appointments are lovely, and they even offer HBO and pay per view movies. Best of all, it is extremely clean. I'm a fanatic about that and with all the talk about hotels with bedbugs I even check the mattresses. This passed inspection with flying colors. And, oh, the staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - not best location”
Reviews.Author: freykr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hampton Inn many times. I have never had any problems, each stay has been a pleasurable experience. There are 5 or 6 hotels near this area, this is the beginning of Phoenix as you come in from the west. It is convenient for me as I have business contacts nearby, close and simple. The facility is modern and clean. This last stay I noticed they had new bedding comforters and pillows, much better than before. Out of all the hotels on the west side near i-10, this one is probably the best. The facility is secure, & the staff is professional. I think they must have upgraded the wifi internet connection also. I have stayed in all parts of this hotel and never had such a strong connection as I did this last stay. The complimentary hot breakfast is similar to most other Hampton Inns I've stayed at. Eggs, a meat, cereal, breads and fruit. I agree with others that it's not the best area, but it's not the worst either. There is not much nearby except a 24 IHOP. I have walked there at night, but I am a big male and I dont recommend walking out at night for for everyone. Over all I like the Hampton Inn I-10 west and recommend it to others staying in that part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Dismal Location”
Reviews.Author: airlinestuff
Reviews.Content: It's a shame that this Hampton is stuck where it is, sandwiched between the Travelers inn and the Phoenix West Inn, in an area where I do not suggest walking alone at night. Yes it is convenient, right off I-10 at 51st., in an area known as Phoenix West. This several block area is dominated by trucker traffic due to the large facility very near for fueling, etc. 18-wheelers are everywhere; not just for diesel fuel, but there are plenty of warehouses nearby as well. However, the only truck noise I heard was in the morning when the overnight truckers started up in the morning at the Phoenix West Inn. I don't know how long ago the hotel was remodeled, but it must have been very recent., inside and out. The grounds are well maintained, but step off their property onto Lasham St. and it looks like a junkyard. Local [walkable] dining is equally dismal, with a few fast food places, and an IHOP. If you want 'real' food, plan on driving a few miles to 75th. Ave. The only full service hotel in the area is the Holiday Inn across I-10. I went there for a few minutes, but it is located in a similar scary area. The large, spotless room itself was great! When I booked it online I had my choice of an easy chair [see photo] or a sleeper sofa. WiFi was fast and easy to connect. The desk area had plenty of available AC sockets. In fact, there was a socket IN the base of the desk lamp. Nice touch! Embarassing selection of TV channels, as in not many. The pool area looked inviting, but it was unlit and the water was too warm to be refreshing after a warm day. Breakfast was a definite highlite, with an excellent fresh selection of everything you would expect from a Hampton lately. It seemed that there was always somebody there checking food supply and refilling if needed. The eating area was large with many tables, and plenty of room. The hotel seems very security consious. The only way to enter the hotel without a room key is through the lobby. At the other entrances, a room key IS required, and this is 24-hours a day. If you need a place to stay in this area, the Hampton does the job nicely, IF you have a car. Now that I think about it though, I cant imagine how you would get there anyway, without transportation. Stay there, but don't venture into the night. What a shame...

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Phoenix West
HotelInfo.Address: 5152 W. Latham Street, Phoenix, AZ 85043 (Formerly Hampton Inn)
